column1: What is an S3 Lifecycle rule?
column2: A rule to transition or expire objects automatically
column3: Use to move cold data to cheaper classes or delete after retention; defined by prefix/tags and actions.
Example: 30d → Standard-IA, 90d → Glacier, 365d → expire to control costs.
E.g., noncurrent versions → Glacier after 30 days; keep last 5 noncurrent versions.

column2: Auto-moves objects between access tiers based on access
column3: Small monitoring fee/object; no retrieval fees for frequent/IA tiers; good for unknown patterns.

column2: Instant Retrieval, Flexible Retrieval, Deep Archive
column3: Instant: ms access; Flexible: minutes–hours; Deep Archive: hours; all for archival cost savings.

column2: Query a subset of object data with SQL
column3: Filter rows/columns from CSV/JSON/Parquet to reduce bytes scanned and costs.

column2: Scheduled object listings with metadata reports
column3: Daily/weekly CSV/ORC/Parquet of objects, sizes, encryption, versions; useful for audits.

column2: Org-wide metrics and dashboards for S3 usage/activity
column3: Find cost-savings, orphaned data, encryption gaps; integrates with AWS Organizations.

column2: Named endpoints with policies for shared datasets
column3: Per-app prefix isolation and permissions; can restrict to a VPC; simplifies multi-tenant access.
Bucket owner owns all objects; manage access via policies; ACLs off by default.

column2: Prefer policies; ACLs are legacy and granular per object
column3: Disable ACLs unless you need per-object grants; use IAM/bucket policies otherwise.
Trigger on create/remove; filter by prefix/suffix; grant destination permissions.

column1: Keep S3 traffic private from VPC?
column3: Gateway endpoints for S3 (general buckets); interface endpoints for features like MRAP.

column2: Global S3 endpoint routing to the closest healthy region
column3: Great for cross-region buckets; supports PrivateLink via interface endpoints.

column2: Bucket-level CORS rules allow cross-origin browser requests
column3: Define allowed origins/methods/headers; required for frontend apps fetching S3.

column1: SPA on S3 website hosting tips?
column2: Set index and error docs; use CloudFront for HTTPS and SPA rewrites
column3: Use CF Functions/Behaviors to route 404 to index.html for client routing.
Keep lifetimes minimal; generate server-side with least-privileged credentials.

column2: Globally unique within AWS partition; DNS-compliant
column3: Avoid dots for TLS compatibility; names reusable after delete but may be delayed.
